direction.raw_text: 1895 - DAY CLOSE UP: Ornate antique GRANDFATHER CLOCK strikes 2:15. The credits begin to roll. Calligraphy place cards are painstakingly hand-written in preparation for a formal reception. Servants meticulously clean an elaborate crystal chandelier. Hands rapidly shine silver cutlery. Fresh flowers arranged in several enormous vases.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kitchen clock strikes 2:15. Poultry plucked. Feathers everywhere. Steaming copper pots boiling over. Platters prepared with decorative garnish. Extravagant tiered cake is lavishly iced. A glob of frosting enters a pair of puckered lips. The perpetrator, a fey, pompous, HEAD VALET, seriously considers the texture and flavor of the icing, then gives the PASTRY CHEF a withering, sour look. The valet, oblivious to the chef's fury, gathers a prepared silver breakfast tray and checks his pocket watch. 2:15.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Antique bedside table clock -- just past 2:15. The valet throws open velvet drapes, sunlight FLOODS the room revealing a figure sleeping soundly in a massive oak framed bed. The valet puts down the tray, pulls back the quilt. The dozing figure gives the valet a deliberate, angry KICK. Flinching infinitesimally, the valet crosses to the closet, selects three suits and holds them up for inspection. From beneath the puffiest of pillows, AN EYE reluctantly opens. A weary arm points decisively to the riding outfit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The riding outfit is adorned by LEOPOLD, Duke of Albany, a dashing, virile man in his 30's. GALLOPING with great abandon, he expertly leads his horse up hills and over hedges. He sends gardeners shaping the grounds fleeing from his path. In the background, lanterns are being strung throughout the estate. Rugs are beaten out of open windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Large hallway clock -- 6:15. A pair of boots track a freshly scrubbed floor as Leopold heads carelessly up the stairway. Three steps behind, the valet snaps his fingers signaling the staff to clean up the mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UPS Gaudily framed portraits of somber relations. A bird sits listless in a gilded cage. Hot water is poured into a bath. Carriages begin to arrive. Orchestra leader signals the musicians to play. Guests fill the ballroom in formal attire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold stares haughtily into a full length mirror. He wears only dotted linen drawers and a black silk top hat of the period. He flexes slightly. The valet hastily fastens a corset around his mid-section from behind. Leopold eyes his reflection seductively. He becomes bored. He turns to his right. The valet spoons sorbet from a silver saucer into his mouth. He turns back to the mirror to watch himself eat. The valet pats his mouth dry. He affects a pampered STRUT, crossing the room as the valet sprays a mixture of perfume and powder into the air. Leopold thrusts out his arms walking through the mist, turns and saunters back to his favorite place, in front of the mirror. Finally, as if weighing a great decision, Leopold hands his hat to his valet and nods firmly into the mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP Fine linen undervest slides over his head. Black twilled worsted trousers pulled up to his waist. The buttoning of his hard, white, roll collar. A cream suede glove stitched in black slides over his hand. A perfect tight bow tie is tied around his neck. An elegant black tuxedo jacket with silk facings and tails to the knees is fitted to his torso. His hair is sleeked with oil and centrally parted. His eyebrows are brushed with a tiny silver comb. His cheeks are pinched. A red silk handkerchief is placed in the bosom of his lapel. Leopold stares into the mirror. The effect is DAZZLING. He raises one eyebrow. Then, in a voice you could pour over a waffle:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He bows. As he rises, the reflection of Leopold's UNCLE OTTO, a pampered, effectual man in his 60's, appears behind Leopold in the looking glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold, stung, takes a moment to compose himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leaves. Leopold stares into the mirror, snaps his fingers. The valet hands him a glass and pours a small shot of brandy. Leopold shoots him a look. The valet fills the glass higher. Leopold drains the glass and heads to the doorway. He hesitates, taking a deep breath and a long pause. Finally...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Without looking back, Leopold leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You dance like a herd of cattle, Miss Fairchild. You are a rare woman who lights up the room... simply by leaving it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell me Leopold, do you plan to join us downstairs after completing this one-sided flash of wit?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I despise affairs of this sort, Uncle Otto. No one really listens to anyone else. If you attempt it, you will see why.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You judge everything too severely. I wonder what would happen if you were to cast that critical eye inward?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You do not wonder at all. You merely ask in order to state your own opinion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are all concerned about you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ahh, here it comes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your life does not seem to have any direction. At the age of 25 a man is too young to do anything well. At 35 he is too old. Now is your time to take action. Tell me, what is it you want to DO with your life?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wearily) I do not know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (just as weary) Your ignorance cramps my conversation. (he slaps Leopold's face twice rather quickly) Wake up! This is your one and only life. Every man has the chance to make a difference. DO something!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I am most grateful for your surveillance and for your sympathy. I assure you there is no need for concern. I am as effectual and attentive... as my position allows.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Life is not position, Leopold. It is action. (he straightens Leopold's tie) I will see you downstairs promptly. In the appropriate frame of mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grandly) Go spread joy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Music fills the air as the creme de la creme of Victorian society gather inside. Leopold holds a prearranged dance card. He looks at the names and finds his first partner is MISS TREE. Leopold looks upward helplessly at an unrelenting God.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A profoundly self-conscious Leopold dances energetically into frame with MISS TREE, an ancient, elfin, yet amazingly SPRY woman who gapes up at him searchingly, unblinking. Leopold opens his mouth to speak, can think of nothing suitable to say, and clamps his mouth shut. They dance out of frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold dances into frame with CLARA, a BEAUTIFUL girl of 19. He glances at her and smiles. She titters, turning away shyly. They whirl around the dance floor. His smile grows into a broad grin. Caught up in the excitement, Clara beams up at him... happily revealing a mouth full of missing, inky teeth. Leopold, face frozen in a formal smile, dances on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold lumbers into frame with MISS FAIRCHILD, a woman of immense girth. With great dignity and extreme difficulty he maneuvers her around the floor, looking everywhere except her enormous bosom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss Fairchild curtseys heavily. Leopold glances at his card, sees the name Miss Serena Clacket and shudders. He spots a VERY LOVELY WOMAN hidden amongst the guests. She scribbles in a small note pad, occasionally glancing around. Hiding his dance card, he saunters over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The young woman stares vacantly at Leopold until she realizes he is addressing her. She puts her pad away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold takes her hand and kisses it gently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold regards her curiously. The orchestra starts up. There is a hubbub amongst the guests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold spots Uncle Otto observing him from across the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold stiffly holds out his arm. A beat. Carlson, stuck, takes it WITH HESITATION and is escorted to the dance floor. They dance. ALL but Leopold and Carlson gaily sing "TA-RA-RA- BOOM-DE-AY." Leopold, flushed, looks quite smitten. Carlson, shy at first, eventually smiles brightly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They half sing, half speak the TA-RA-RA-BOOM-DE-AY, their emphasis on "BOOM." Laughing giddily, their dancing becomes freer, picking up speed. The room SPINS. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a slight pause. The Grandfather CLOCK strikes midnight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold takes a glass of champagne from a passing waiter. He watches Carlson pass through the crowd and out the courtyard door. He surveys the room. After a moment he follows her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You dance like an angel, Miss Fairchild. You light up the room. I thank you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good evening. I do not believe I have had the pleasure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...Julia Carlson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry. Will you excuse me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (slightly tipsy) You are not from the area, are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiles and shakes her head "No") Are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is my estate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Really? (looking around the room) Well it's not home but it's much...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shocking! The TA-RA-RA-BOOM-DE-AY.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The? Oh, that's from Paris, isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is a scandal nonetheless.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Miss Carlson, do me the honor?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm afraid I'm not much of a dancer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (smiling seductively) Truly I would be in your debt. Any admonition would be erased simply by presenting a partner as lovely as yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, no. Really, I...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I suppose we really ought to sing along.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (embarrassed) Oh, golly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (breathless) Thank you for the dance. It was lovely. I hope it wasn't too awful for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Not at all. It was most enlightening.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I really must be going.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I won't hear of it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (moving away from him) No, I'm quite late as it is.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I shall see you to the door...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stopping him resolutely) You're very sweet. I had a wonderful time. (she watches him, memorizing his face. Then firmly) Goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Leopold makes his way through the manicured garden in the dark. He hears an EERIE METALLIC SOUND. He slows down, brushes back the thicket. The silhouette of a woman is revealed. She is once again writing in her notebook.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlson spins around quickly, panicked. Leopold STOPS. Partially hidden in the brush, a sleek, oddly shaped, MECHANICAL device. It's door open, lit from within, casting a weird glow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold moves toward the contraption and is about to touch it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Carlson shakes her head, unsure of how to proceed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold carefully examines the apparatus, stepping inside. Carlson FREEZES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His hand comes to rest on a glowing red lever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She YANKS on his arm. Instinctively he pulls away, accidentally thrusting the lever into action. Carlson falls from the machine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The machine LIGHTS UP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The compartment door snaps shut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a BRIGHT WHITE FLASH. Blackness fills the screen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Miss Carlson?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good God...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What are you...? You frightened me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What sort of mechanism is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Answer me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's perfectly all right. It's...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (carefully, deliberately) Listen to me. Please. Move very slowly. Step out of the machine. Step out and I'll explain whatever you want to know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is this? Who are you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, God.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (suddenly frantic) Get out of there! Get out now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Miss Carlson... I...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .Y.C. LABORATORY - 1995 DAY The compartment door slides OPEN revealing DR. KAU, 30's, an Asian doctor with a THICK BROOKLYN ACCENT. Her face full of enthusiasm drops as she sees the unconscious Leopold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns to her co-workers, warning them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She looks back at Leopold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her co-workers, DR. PLODDER, austere, authoritative, DR. DRAKE, muddled and timid, peer inside the compartment door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Drake and Kau make a move to inspect an unconscious Leopold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They approach Leopold. Dr. Kau finds Carlson's note pad on the ground next to Leopold. She reads the last entry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all look at one another, then back at Leopold.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU Shit!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU Shit!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU Shit!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . DRAKE Good God!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER Everybody stay calm... Lock the front door.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER No, no, no. You mustn't touch him. The consequences could be catastrophic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU He could be hurt, or even dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER ...All right. Touch him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU ...But I'm stuck and it's only a dance and he IS the seventh Duke of Albany...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . DRAKE Carlson...!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER (racing from the room) Give me a minute...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU Shit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: a radiant workaholic, types frenetically into the computer while talking on the phone, trying hard not to sound upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She stops typing and listens for a while. She runs her hand through her hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The line goes dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Plodder bursts in. Kate sees his distress and instantly becomes very centered.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hands her Carlson's note pad. Slowly, she sits down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who's upset? People fall in love, they have to climb back out. (she laughs but she is not smiling) So, what? We'll just be friends now, Right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I see. Well I appreciate your honesty. (using her middle finger she pushes up her glasses) No. I'll just think of this as surviving another dating accident. Take care or good luck or whatever I'm supposed to...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...say... Goodbye.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER She's back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rising) That's impossible! She wasn't supposed to return until...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER Kate. It's Carlson. Something went wrong.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...The 7th Duke...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (all business, reading from a printout) ...of Albany. He was the... IS the son of Emery and Eliza. He was of no actual importance until he vanished at the turn of the century without a trace. It was a sensation. In the 30's they even made a movie about him. "The Tenuous Duke" with Ronald Coleman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a stunned silence. They stare at Leopold in awe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all nod in agreement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She forces back panic. Only the tremor in her voice gives her away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They nod reluctantly. Drake writes out names and throws them in a cup. The silence becomes deafening. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All the scientists face her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She reaches in. They wait with mounting suspense. Finally SHE TURNS TO KATE. The scientists follow her gaze. A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold stirs. He blinks at the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctors, caught off guard, SMILE BENIGNLY. They surround Leopold as a group, not knowing where to begin. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all laugh nervously. Leopold does not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold nods at them as if they are insane.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold starts to speak.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Awkward pause. Leopold looks carefully around the room for the first time: modern mechanical equipment, data shifting and changing, giant cooling devices, bright neon lighting. The doctors are silent.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold leaps up. The doctors follow him around the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's out the door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: . DRAKE (absently) I love Ronald Coleman.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Despite much speculation and a nation wide investigation, a body was never found. He was never heard from again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU Until now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . DRAKE We've altered the course of history.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU We never should have started this...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Calm down.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER What are we going to do? We can't keep him here. Imagine if anyone found out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Think. Just, think. Rationally. Now, no one would believe such a stupid mistake could be made because no one would believe any of this is possible. So. We fix this. We keep this to ourselves and we fix it. Fast.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Kau, research all our data. 1st priority: Locate Carlson. Drake, determine the reciprocal correlation's connected to the 19th century. Work 24 hours a day if necessary. In the meantime... one of us will have to take charge of him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is a major scientific opportunity. It doesn't get any better than this. Imagine. Researching the behavior, the physical and emotional characteristics of a century ago! Utilizing technology available to us today... He's a gold mine!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER He's a man, Kate. Not a guinea pig.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And while he's here, he's ours. Any volunteers?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . DRAKE We'll draw names. Whoever is is picked will be responsible. Agreed?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU I'll do it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER You'll look after him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU No, I meant I'll pick the name.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where...? What has happened?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your Grace... Um... Hello... Weee aaare a smaaall part of a laaarge research team. A project funded by the government of the United States.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (regarding their appearance with distaste) Oh. Americans. I see...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, um... For the past six and a half years we've been conducting scientific experiments on density and flexibility in the dimensions of time and space.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . DRAKE Yes, uh... Quite by accident we came upon a formula utilizing Tachyons... particles traveling faster than the speed of light, which allowed us to... fold time so to speak.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER Yes. Bend it between the cracks of the dimensions.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU Yes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . DRAKE Now, while that wasn't the original purpose of our experiment, we opted to pursue it, well, privately, on our own.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU Borrowing funds already provided.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We journeyed to your time because it was the quickest path to follow. We debated long and hard whether we should use this knowledge at all. Believe me, it was never our intent to disturb the past...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . DRAKE Merely to discover if the expedition were possible. As your presence here confirms... we are very disturbed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER The problem facing us is not only HOW to get you back, but WHEN, you see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We certainly don't want to miscalculate. Send you to a different era entirely.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER Rest assured, no harm will come to you. You'll be well looked after by Dr. Coles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Coles...? I do not follow. What do you mean, get me back home?... Where am I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Answer me!... (slowly) Would you have me believe... I am being detained, at present in the HEREAFTER?... The time to come?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER (carefully) It is the year nineteen hundred and ninety-five.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're insane! All of you! This is impossible!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER Leopold, calm down!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A voyage through time! What do you take me for? Did you bring me here by force?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . DRAKE We're scientist, not seditionists.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (truly panicked) Let me out of here! I won't stand for this another moment!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Leopold moves quickly, fearfully through the darkly lit hallway, the doctors close behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is too late. Leopold throws open the door and runs upstairs.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Leopold, wait!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU You don't know what you're doing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . PLODDER Just listen to what we have to say!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Blinding sunlight. Skyscrapers. Automobiles. Traffic lights. Road construction. Modern day pedestrians. Helicopters. Car alarms. Leopold stands frozen, overwhelmed, taking it all in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctors reach him. He collapses to the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate and Dr. Kau talk quietly. Leopold, tightly holding onto his seat and the back door, gazes out the window in utter disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold, trembling, gapes at the sights, every day sounds, magnified. Perspiration runs down the side of his face. Kate watches him in her rear view mirror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Kau stares at Kate in concerned silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Squab.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU Squab?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I remember reading they ate a lot of squab.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU Squab... Do you have a squab?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly. On the verge of panic) I don't know!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . KAU Pull yourself together! (turning to Leopold) Are you all right back there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going to be fine you know. There's nothing to worry about. I have everything under control.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly to Dr. Kau) We'll never get away with this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Leopold awakens alone in his room. He sits up with a jolt. His stomach sinks as he realizes THIS IS NO DREAM. He slowly rises to his full stature, moving to the window he looks out on the modern day city, shaking his head in awe. He makes his way to the bedroom door and tentatively touches the knob. There is a KNOCK on the door. Leopold JUMPS back and runs to the bed: The picture of dignity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold regards her dubiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold watches her with great interest. Finally:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate grabs the teacup grandly and leaves the room.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How are you feeling? (no response) I thought you might like some tea.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I insist on being returned home immediately.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand. We're doing our best.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I wish to speak with your employer, Dr. Coles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're speaking to him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are not suggesting that you are Dr. Coles?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Miss... uh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dr. Coles. If you like, you could call me Miss Dr. Coles or if that's too much, how about just plain Kate?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (coldly)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: of science?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hard to believe?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But a woman's brain cannot obtain enough knowledge to posses a truly scientific mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jotting this down) Interesting. Nevertheless, we've come a long way baby.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Leopold listens at the door. He slowly opens it, takes two steps out, peers around the corner, then quickly steps back in. He takes a DEEP FRIGHTENED BREATH and slowly deflates.

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you... Has it been decided what it is I am to do while I am being held here?

dialogue.raw_text: (clearing her throat) I took the liberty of preparing a simple schedule to efficiently utilize your time while incorporating you into my routine. (she hands him a schedule) As you can see, my day begins with meditation and yoga from 6:30 to 7:00.

dialogue.raw_text: will arise at 6:45, shower and change and at 7:15, we breakfast together. 7:45 we begin the days work. At 10:45 Dr. Kau arrives to observe you in your natural routine as I research the data that will enable you to return home. At 1:15 we lunch together. 2:15 you answer a daily questionnaire, I type up my notes. At precisely 6:15 you will enjoy 15 minutes of FREE TIME, then, at 6:30, I listen to Tom Brokaw while making dinner as YOU write down any questions that come up during your day. At 7:00, we dine together. If you need me at any time you may ring this bell.

dialogue.raw_text: Now, Mondays and Wednesdays I have computer science class, Tuesdays I have therapy. IF I have a date, I'm usually home by 9:15. During these periods you may read any of the books I've picked out for you in your room. I organize my next days work at 10:30, 11:35, David Letterman, 12:40 I'm in bed. (she takes a breath, smiles at him) Next day we begin again. Simple?

direction.raw_text: Leopold PEEKS around the entrance to the living room. Confident it's unoccupied, he majestically walks inside: Up to date gadgetry, Charlie's modern art work, bright fashionable furniture. Leopold recoils. His eyes come to rest on the television set. The ON OFF buttons loom large. He looks around the room then brazenly presses the button ON. Instantly, REGIS and KATHY LEE loudly berate each other before an excited crowd. Leopold jumps back several feet, hands flailing in front of him as if shooing away a bee. He quickly, yet cautiously, slams the power OFF.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He quickly scurries out the hallway. He stops abruptly. He remains very still. Composing himself, he turns and deliberately faces the room. After a moment, he purposefully steps back inside. He makes a large ARC around the television set, is confronted by one of Charlie's sculptures and makes an ARC around that. He finds himself in front of a light switch and gingerly examines it. As he does, track lighting ILLUMINATES the room. He looks at the lights then back at the switch. He flicks the lights ON and OFF, trying to figure out the precise moment in the transfer of power, laughing in spite of himself. Kate and Charlie enter. They watch Leopold flicking the lights, laughing like a madman. Charlie gives Kate a look.

dialogue.raw_text: Horrible!

dialogue.raw_text: May I remind you, merchant, that I am the customer in this establishment and as such require your attention and the utmost respect. I do not accept this modern convention of desecrating one's patrons with such contemptuous disregard.

dialogue.raw_text: You tell him.

dialogue.raw_text: (nearly in tears, trying to dry him off) Leopold! Oh, Leopold thank God you're all right. I didn't think I'd ever find you. You had us all so worried. Oh, Leopold!

dialogue.raw_text: Don't you ever go out again without my permission, do you hear me? I was frantic. You could have been killed a hundred times over. I never would have known.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leopold, are you all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (looking deep into her eyes for the first time) I wish to go home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Okay. I'll get you home in a jiffy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (badly shaken) No... I wish to go home.

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) I don't know. It's just Leopold. Like Cher. Or Goofy. Kate and Leopold walk in wet and exhausted.

direction.raw_text: There is a long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at each other just a second too long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They self-consciously head to their respective rooms.

direction.raw_text: Kate is struck by his vulnerability for the first time and is moved. She catches herself quickly however.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They stand at their bedroom doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leopold smiles, still shaken. A beat. They slowly close the doors to their respective rooms.

dialogue.raw_text: Never mind they just walked in. Jesus. You look horrible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Charlie, don't start. I haven't been this angry at you since you got me into that pyramid thing last year. If you make a wisecrack I'm going to burst into flame.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It wasn't a wisecrack. You do look horrible.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm too tired for this now. I'll just save it up and kill you tomorrow. Help Leopold out of his things and lets get him to bed.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've something to say. To the both of you. I... Nothing is what it seems. After witnessing mere weeks of this age it is painfully apparent I am outside of my acquaintance... I don't know how to proceed. I frankly... am in need of assistance. I'm sorry. I'm not very good at this. In the event you have missed it, I am apologizing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: About time. (he shakes Leopold's hand reluctantly) Welcome back. (he leaves)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't mind him. His heart would be in the right place if he had a heart. Surliness runs in my family.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I understand. It practically races through mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shocked) Leopold, you made a joke. I mean one that's not at my expense. That's good.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We'd better get to bed... That is...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes... I start work... (she looks at her watch) in three and a half hours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, dear.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's fine. I'm used to it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You mustn't get too used to it. You'll find life passes you by awfully quickly.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you for...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (waving it away) Oh!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, goodnight then.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Leopold?... I don't have a clear handle on this. Perhaps I was wrong keeping you confined to the apartment all this time. I don't know when you'll be able return home... Tomorrow I'll start preparing you for the outside world. And... We'll find your way back. I promise.

dialogue.raw_text: Women are longer defined by the men they're married to, Leopold. I have a career. I haven't found a man who fits in with that yet.

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sharply) I'm thirty! But you're the first person whoever told me I looked it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm sorry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And it's not that I insist on remaining single. Believe me. Everyone dreams of finding somebody to share their life with. To give someone all the love they've been hoarding since they were a kid. I'm no different. But one has to be sensible. I have a career and a life that's filled with...

dialogue.raw_text: Not again...

direction.raw_text: Leopold asleep on the sofa still clutching the remote control. Kate comes in with a blanket and settles it over Leopold. She glances around the room, then slowly bends down close to capture a better look at his face. After a moment she catches herself, takes herself in hand and sits down at her computer. She opens her notes and types. Her fingers slow down to a crawl and come to a stop. She looks up at Leopold lost in thought. She smiles. Reaching for a soda, she accidentally knocks a picture to the floor. In a SMASHED frame, Kate and CARLSON drunkenly mug for the camera. Kate pales noticeably. She looks from the picture to Leopold. Slowly, she begins pecking away at the keys. She does not look up again.

direction.raw_text: Elderly Blue haired couples chat amongst themselves, men on the right, women on the left. Kate, in dance clothes, out of breath, stumbles in, making a b-line for the women's side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Pincus executes a fancy spin, proudly showing off her purchase. Across the room, MR. Pincus beams in anticipation. An elderly, overly made up dance instructor enters. She claps her hands together loudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men slick back their hair. The women straighten their gowns. Kate stands to the side, self-consciously studying the floor. The men take their places on the dance floor. They flick their hand twice, inviting their women to dance. Cooly, elegantly, the women approach their partners. After a while Kate looks up, relieved. She stands alone. Ballroom music plays. The couples effortlessly shift between steps and turns. Kate dances with an imaginary partner, stumbling, more than a beat behind, counting, animated, a concentrated YEARNING look spread across her face. The instructor approaches with a look of resignation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kate does. Her instructor shakes her head and moves away. Across the room, through the window, Leopold watches, moved.

dialogue.raw_text: Oh.

She looks up in disbelief and glances through her window around the lab. Everyone is hard at work. Helplessly, she stares back at the paper on her desk. She pulls open her drawer and takes out the picture of Carlson. She stares at it for a long time. She opens her mouth to call for the others, stops, and looks at the photo. Slowly, with great indecision, Kate crumples up the paper. She returns the picture to the drawer. After a long moment, she opens a book, feigning research, her mind a million miles away.

direction.raw_text: Inside, old black and white photographs, newspaper clippings, magazine articles trace Leopold throughout his life. A photograph of Leopold looking as he did the night he departed this world. He stands stiffly beside his family for a formal portrait. Very discreetly, he points to a ring. It is the same ring Kate gave him. A newspaper article shows Leopold donating $100,000 to establish a scientific center researching studies in time and space. A magazine picture shows Leopold, the sole male figure, marching to give women the vote. A photograph of a large formal wedding. Leopold, around FIFTY, stands alone in the wedding party, surreptitiously pointing to his ring. A magazine article shows Leopold in his SIXTIES establishing a scholarship program for studies in physics. He is surrounded by academia and subtly points to his ring. A photograph of Leopold around SEVENTY shaking hands with Albert Einstein and smiling broadly for the cameras. A professional photograph of Leopold at SEVENTY FIVE, sitting regally in a chair. Beside him, an EMPTY chair. He rests one hand on the back of the chair. The other he holds against his chest, showing off the ring. An obituary with the headline, "Philanthropist, 80, dies in bombings. A tear falls on the page. Kate cries silently, looking out the window. The camera follows her gaze past her property...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and his BRIDE take to the floor for the first time as husband and wife and are greeted with applause. Kate, older, beautiful, hair cut short, looks on in wonder. Charlie, standing with Patrice and their 6 blonde children, approaches Kate and leads her to the dance floor.

direction.raw_text: Julia Carlson, under dressed, over anxious, enters the banquet hall. She stands at the back of the large room, searching. Couples fill the dance floor. Across the expansive room, over the tops of heads, Charlie and Kate bob amongst the guests. Leo cuts in. As they spin, in the briefest of seconds, Kate spots Carlson. She pales. They TURN. Kate peers over Leo's shoulder. Her eyes lock with Julia's. Julia nods with purpose. Kate holds onto Leo tightly, not wanting to let go. She buries her head in his chest.

direction.raw_text: 1924 - NIGHT A FLASH of light illuminates the forest at the Albany estate. A BEAT. Kate races from the forest onto a massive lawn, stumbling in mud as she hurries to the mansion's entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huge double doors open to reveal -- AN ORNATE BALLROOM. The creme de la creme have gathered and dance. Kate overwhelmed, rushes down an elaborate staircase. Half way down she looses a shoe. She hesitates briefly then continues to the dance floor. In the center of the floor, Leopold, looking very distinguished and attractive, dances with a flirtatious young woman. Try as she might, Leopold keeps her at a distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The music changes: A LIVELY CHARLESTON. Leopold heaves a sigh of relief and makes his way through the crowd, up the staircase. The dancers become an intricate maze, a dead end at every turn as Kate searches each male face. In the foreground, Leopold is stopped by a woman midway up the stairs. As they chat, Leopold reaches down and picks up the muddy slipper, offering it to her. She turns in a huff, flouncing down the stairs. Simultaneously, in the background, Kate desperately looks for Leopold. Leopold studies the slipper as he makes his way up the stairs. He slows down, hesitates and STOPS. Very slowly he turns around. He becomes very still. TEARS well up in his eyes. The ballroom clock strikes MIDNIGHT. Kate climbs an opposite staircase to get a better view then STOPS. In her heart SHE KNOWS. Slowly she turns. Leopold stands quietly at the bottom of the stairs, gazing up at her. He extends his arm, showing her THE RING. He offers her his hand. The crowd, the room, THE WORLD AROUND THEM, DISAPPEAR. Their eyes lock. As she descends the staircase, THE YEARS MELT AWAY. Kate's short hair grows long, cascading around her shoulders. The fine lines around Leopold's face are gone. They see themselves through each other's eyes, at the moment of youth, when they fell in love. Leopold bends down, places the slipper on Kate's foot. He rises, looks down at his hands and then up at Kate. His hands are caked with mud. She smiles helplessly. Not caring, he wraps his arms tightly around her.

The rest of the world dances around them. Over this background... THE SCRAPBOOK PICTURES BLEED ONTO SCREEN. The old formal wedding photo becomes a photograph of Kate and Leopold the perfect bride and groom, both discreetly point to their rings. Kate stands with Leopold as he establishes a scholarship for studies in physics. The old photograph of Leopold and Albert Einstein changes to include Kate, waving and smiling broadly for the camera. The professional photograph becomes a double portrait. It shows the two in their 70's, sitting regally in matching chairs. They hold hands and smile serenely. Staring directly into the camera, they show off their rings.
